description:
Comprehensive performance monitoring dashboard for DBLogsComparator.
Monitors performance across Elasticsearch, Loki, and VictoriaLogs.

Sections:
- Performance Overview & Throughput Analysis
- Success/Error Rates & Retry Statistics  
- Configuration & Volume & Response Times
- Query Results Analysis & Log Type Distribution
- Go Application Metrics

Variables: datasource, job, system, interval

panels.description: Current requests per second for generator and querier components. Shows real-time load being applied to the system.
panels.title: Current RPS

panels.description: Total logs generated per second across all log types. Indicates overall log generation rate.
panels.title: Logs per Second (Total)

panels.description: Current batch size configuration for log generation per system. Affects throughput and memory usage. Higher values increase throughput but consume more memory.
panels.title: Bulk Size

panels.description: Log generation rate broken down by log type (application, web_access, web_error, etc.). Helps identify which log types are being generated most frequently.
panels.title: Logs\Requests per Second by Type

panels.description: Query throughput broken down by query type and system. Helps identify which query types are most frequent.
panels.title: Queries per Second by Type

panels.description: Total throughput of log generation per system. Shows how many logs per second each logging system is receiving.
panels.title: Generator RPS\LPS (Total)

panels.description: Total throughput of log generation per system. Shows how many logs per second each logging system is receiving.
panels.title: Generator LPS by Type (Total)

panels.description: Total query throughput per system. Shows how many queries per second each system is processing.
panels.title: Querier RPS (Total)

panels.description: Query throughput broken down by query type and system. Helps identify which query types are most frequent.
panels.title: Querier RPS by Type

panels.description: Rate of successful write requests per system. Higher values indicate better write performance and system reliability.
panels.title: Write Success Rate (Total)

panels.description: Rate of failed write requests per system and error type. Lower values indicate better reliability. Monitor for spikes which may indicate system issues.
panels.title: Write Error Rate (Total)

panels.description: Rate of successful read/query requests per system. Higher values indicate better query performance and system responsiveness.
panels.title: Read Success Rate (Total)

panels.description: Rate of failed read/query requests per system and error type. Lower values indicate better query reliability. Spikes may indicate query complexity issues or system overload.
panels.title: Read Error Rate (Total)

panels.description: Rate of successful read/query requests per system. Higher values indicate better query performance and system responsiveness.
panels.title: Read Success Rate (By type)

panels.description: Rate of failed read/query requests per system and error type. Lower values indicate better query reliability. Spikes may indicate query complexity issues or system overload.
panels.title: Read Error Rate (By type)

panels.description: Rate of write request retries per system. High values may indicate network issues, system overload, or temporary unavailability. Monitor trends to identify performance degradation.
panels.title: Write Retries (Total)

panels.description: Detailed breakdown of retry attempts by retry attempt number. Helps identify if issues are resolved quickly or require multiple retry attempts.
panels.title: Retry Attempts by Type

panels.description: Time series showing cumulative logs sent over time by system and log type. Useful for tracking progress and identifying periods of high activity.
panels.title: Logs Sent Over Time

panels.description: Average write request response time per system. Lower values indicate better write performance. Calculated as total time divided by request count.
panels.title: Write Response Time (Average)

panels.description: 95th percentile write response time by status and system. Shows worst-case write performance. Values above thresholds indicate performance issues.
panels.title: Write Response Time by Status ($percentile)

panels.description: 95th percentile read response time by status and system. Shows worst-case query performance. High values may indicate complex queries or system overload.
panels.title: Read Success Response Time by Status ($percentile)

panels.description: 95th percentile read response time by status and system. Shows worst-case query performance. High values may indicate complex queries or system overload.
panels.title: Read Failed Response Time by Status ($percentile)

panels.description: Average number of hits returned by queries, broken down by query type and system. Shows which query types typically return more results. Useful for understanding query efficiency.
panels.title: Query Result Hits by Type (Average)

panels.description: Average size of query results in bytes, broken down by query type and system. Shows which query types transfer more data. Important for bandwidth planning.
panels.title: Query Result Bytes by Type (Average)

panels.description: Average number of hits returned by queries, broken down by query type and system. Shows which query types typically return more results. Useful for understanding query efficiency.
panels.title: Query Result Hits by Type ($percentile)

panels.description: Average size of query results in bytes, broken down by query type and system. Shows which query types transfer more data. Important for bandwidth planning.
panels.title: Query Result Bytes by Type ($percentile)

panels.description: Distribution of sent logs by type across all systems. Shows which log types are generated most frequently. Useful for understanding workload characteristics and data patterns.
panels.title: Sent Log Type Dispersion

panels.description: Distribution of queries by type across all systems. Shows which query types are executed most frequently. Helps identify common query patterns and optimization opportunities.
panels.title: Query Type Dispersion

panels.description: Detailed breakdown of logs sent by type and system over time. Shows trends in log generation patterns and helps identify changes in workload distribution.
panels.title: Log Type Distribution Over Time

panels.description: Detailed breakdown of queries by type and system over time. Shows trends in query patterns and helps identify changes in usage behavior or application requirements.
panels.title: Query Type Distribution Over Time

panels.description: Go runtime version information. Shows which Go version the application is running on. Important for compatibility and performance analysis.
panels.title: Go Version

panels.description: CPU usage percentage per job. Higher values indicate more CPU intensive operations. Values over 80% may indicate performance bottlenecks.
panels.title: CPU Usage

panels.description: Number of active goroutines per job. Indicates concurrency level and potential goroutine leaks. Sudden spikes may indicate resource leaks.
panels.title: Goroutines

panels.description: Number of OS threads created per job. Shows thread utilization. High values may indicate excessive thread creation or blocking operations.
panels.title: OS Threads

panels.description: Memory allocation and heap usage over time. Shows memory consumption patterns. Steady increases may indicate memory leaks, spikes indicate high allocation periods.
panels.title: Memory Usage

panels.description: Network transmission and reception rates per job. Shows network load and data transfer patterns. High values may indicate network bottlenecks.
panels.title: Network I/O

panels.description: Average garbage collection duration over time. Higher values may indicate memory pressure or inefficient memory usage patterns. Spikes correlate with application pauses.
panels.title: Garbage Collection Duration

panels.description: Open and maximum file descriptors per job. Shows resource utilization and potential limits. Values approaching maximum may indicate resource exhaustion.
panels.title: File Descriptors

panels.description: Combined view of key Go runtime metrics: goroutines, threads, CPU usage, and memory allocation. Provides a quick overview of application health and resource utilization.
panels.title: Runtime Overview

title: LogGenerator Metrics
